page.title: 11Tidwell House near Salterton
page.content: Tidwell House is a delightful georgian country house about a mile away from the town centre.It was originally commissioned as a manor house for Lord Rolle,a wealthy landowner,in 1725. Mr Simpson now runs the house as an hotel.When he first came to the house it was delapidated.The large apple orchard had over 2000 diseased trees so it had to be cut down. The house contains 21 large rooms all about 17 feet long and 14 feet wide. We asked Mr Simpson whether the house was haunted.He said that he did not know but,in the middle of one night he had heard footsteps going up to the roof.He thought it was his son but he was fast asleep and there was nobody else there.There is said to be the ghost of a horse on the top floor and a boy in a brown cloak on the ground floor.The cellars are now a restaurant
